data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You can only take 10 steps backwards if you are facing backwards. The first instructions said you would face forward. If you walk in that direction, you would only be facing left. So, the answer is Yes.

Yes is a command that would turn around. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It takes 4 steps to go around and 6 steps to return. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
On the first round of the instruction we take 7 steps then 1 step, then 7 steps then 1 step again. The whole order was the same until 7th round. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You cannot make a circle back to the starting point when you take 5 steps. The answer: Yes.

You cannot go from one point to another. Turn first right then turn back around. Turn left then turns right. Take 7 steps to return. Thus, the answer is No.

If you always face forward and take 4 steps forward they will all return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Step forward is the first step to take in the direction we are facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.

You should always begin facing forward as you walk. To get back to the starting point, you can take steps towards the right, take 8 steps right. The starting point is at the starting point (forward). So, the answer is Yes.

Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If one always faces forward, they will always take the same path. When one faces the right, they will always take the same path. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, you may take 2 steps backward or 6 steps left. You take 1 step forward and 3 steps right after each step and once they are taken you always take back 1 step and take 3 steps right. Thus, the answer is No.

Turn right and change directions to turn around. Turn left and change directions to turn left. Take 8 steps to get back to starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, you do not need to go backward. If you always face left, you do not need to go backward. If you always face right, you do not need to go backward. So, the answer is No.
